main.docTitle:
Civil Service Pension Reserve Fund
Resolution of the Legislative Council
main.text: Resolution made and passed by the Legislative Council under section 29 of the Public Finance Ordinance (Cap. 2) on 25 January 1995.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there shall be established a fund to be called the Civil Service Pension Reserve Fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Fund shall be administered by the Financial Secretary who may delegate his power of administration to other public officers;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: there shall be credited to the Fund—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: such moneys as may be appropriated for the purpose; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: all sums received by way of interest or dividend on moneys invested under paragraph (f);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary may expend moneys from the Fund for the purpose of meeting the liabilities for payment of pensions, gratuities or other allowances under the Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89), the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) or the Pension Benefits (Judicial Officers) Ordinance (Cap. 401) if, at the end of any month in a financial year, he believes that the balance in the General Revenue Account will be in deficit at the end of that financial year, having taken into account all anticipated receipts and payments;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary in his discretion may authorize the investment in such manner as he may determine of any moneys held in the Fund at any time.
